file_insights.changes: Updated with comprehensive benchmark results for memory write patterns

patterns_discovered: Interleaved multi-output writes are 2.53x faster than sequential writes
Direct write-every-bar pattern outperforms buffered writes
Perfect linear scaling for parallel outputs up to 8 outputs
gotchas_discovered: Buffered writes are consistently 10-27% slower than direct writes
Multi-pass sequential processing is significantly less efficient

approach_outcome.decision: NO-GO for buffered writes, CONDITIONAL GO for interleaved multi-output
performance_implications: Single-pass multi-output is 25% faster than multi-pass
Throughput consistent at 913 Melem/s for single output

recommendations: Avoid buffering and chunking for memory-intensive operations
Consider interleaved writes for multi-output indicators
